A Gabe Newell Game.
great story, much "BANG!", such a storyline, PERFECT 10/10

Even though its not as good as the first Half-Life, it's still pretty much an excellent game in its own right and still holds up  Very Well in terms of Graphics and Gameplay.
Everyone on Steam should have this and the 1st Game in their Library IMHO.

Pros+
+Good Storyline, a Great Tour De Force IMO.
+Likeable and Lively Characters.
+Best Character Facial Expressions I've ever seen in a Game.
+Good and Clever Puzzles, especially the ones that involve use of the Gravity Gun (One of the Best Video Game Guns IMO).
+Lots of Great Mods like Black Mesa, SMOD, and Underhell for Example

Cons- 
-I thought the Enemy Variety was lacking, you fight Combine Soldiers and Synths for most of the Game, and you hardly encounter the Xen Aliens (Save the Headcrab and their Zombie Hosts) from the Last Game (I miss the Houndeye and Bullsquids ;_;).
-Compared to the Last Game, the Arsenal felt Generic (The Pulse Rifle was a pretty cool Weapon, though I wish they kept the Tau Cannon or Gulon Gun from the Last one).

No matter what I didn't like about this, it gets a 10/10.

I am going to some this up with one statement because I am sure there are millions of people who will go into the details. This is my favorite game ever. and this is undoutably one of the greatest games ever made.

I'm going to edit this and say that even in 2016, this game still plays better than most of the games that come after it. In fact, this game makes the entire gaming industry look absolutely pathetic. It has been over a decade since this game released and the industry has failed to produce something that matches this game, setting aside Bioshock. This game STILL feels modern with beautiful visuals, amazing acting, perfect level design, incredible story telling, great characters, fenominal gameplay that is simple but never boring, and this isn't even half of what can be said of this game.

This game is an amazing singleplayer experience. But it's an even better multiplayer one, thanks to Synergy!

I already recommended Half Life 2 to some of my closest friends but I would also like to recommend it to the rest of my friends or complete strangers, because Half Life 2 is simply perfect! They put lots of effort to make it exciting and breathtaking experience. They created an excellent and very mysterious story full of twists and surprises. So even if you won't find many challenging fights there (compared to Half Life, which was definitely more difficult), you will still want to keep going and see what more is waiting for you out there..

I also want to recommended Half Life 2 to all the companies who come every year with new but mediocre games. No more graphics over gameplay and story please!

Serieux qu'est ce qu'il y a à dire à part que c'est un des meilleurs fps actuellement pour moi ? L'histoire est sympa ( sans plus ), le gameplay vraiment plaisant, l'univers / l'ambiance très prenants, la VF vraiment bonne ( je la préfère aux voix anglaises et puis elles sont bien meilleures que celles du 1 ). Franchement pour 10€ ca vaut vraiment le coup ( de plus il y a pleins de choses secondaires sympa comme les mods ( par exemple le mod Synergy pour faire le jeu en coop ).

Half-Life 2 is a very diverse game. Though action-packed, you'll also have moments when you are forced to stop and think... what items do I need and how do I use them to get past this obstacle? Using machinery or sometimes by simply stacking up objects.

In some areas you'll be able to drive in a buggy or hover boat with onboard alien weapons, accompanied by fast-paced music to get your heart pumping. You'll also have to cross some scary areas that you don't want to do just before going to bed.

I love the controls in this game and there's a nice variety of weapons you can use. The story and the great gameplay makes you wanna keep on playing even after you've finished the game.

You can have lots of hours of fun playing through the different difficulty modes. One of my most favorite games, definitely worth to try out!

Si te gustan los shooters, las plataformas, los puzles, los survival horror, los juegos de conducción... Pero lo mas importante una buena historia, este es tu juego. Puede que no tenga el mejor multijugador y no sea el juego mas divertido. Pero si te gustan los buenos videojuegos, este te encantará. Otro rasgo muy impotante de este juego es que te deja jugar, el juego dura unas de 15 horas  y tiene solamente dos "cinemáticas" en las que sigues teniedo control sobre tu personaje y la cámara no cambia. Puede que ya llegue tarde para recomendaroslo, porque si no habéis jugado a este juego ya estáis tardando, pero desde luego que este juego no le afectará el tiempo, y seguirá estando por encima que otros muchos juegos actuales que cuestan 50€ en pc y 70€ en consolas de nueva generación.
Игра моего детства! 10/10.

This was the first PC game I fell in love with. Now coming back to it years later, and I still love it.

The story is well paced, and the visuals and soundtrack are really atmospheric.

My only gripe is the challenges can become a bit samey. First time you shoot down a helicopter it feels great, second time is OK, by your third it is getting to be a bit humdrum, and following that it is simply a dull, boring challenge that you would happily skip past if you could. However, that problem is hardly unique to HL2, and it is more compelling than most.

Altogether a great game - well worth paying for.

HL-2 is one of my all-time top favorite series. Everything about this sequel is top notch.

Revolutionary for it's time, but mediocre by today's standards. I bought and played through all Half-Life games and their respective DLCs in order to understand what all the hype for HL3 was about. They were decent I guess, but you aren't missing much.

About as lackluster as any other modern shooter, with tedious physics puzzles to fill the gaps between engagements. Each 'mission' plays like the parts of a movie that don't get shown - you're just traversing over a long distance to get to the next story moment. Story itself is interesting, but not conveyed clearly. The characters behave and talk like aliens. Gordon is a mute blank slate Mary Sue, accompanied by his also Mary Sue sidekick who has a thing for dudes with autism I guess, along with other boring one-dimensional characters... and then one interesting multi-dimensional character who we learn nothing about.

No where near as good as people make it out to be, even considering the time period it came out in.  Not terrible or anything but seriously don't buy into the massive hype

Half Life 2 is a simply beautiful game and one that, since my first play through has always been a firm entry in my Top 5 games I've ever played Ever ever. It was the first Valve game I ever had the privilage to play back in 2009 when I managed to get a hold of the Orange box for PS3 and since then I still cite it as an example of how to  *Almost* make a perfect game. 

This opinion was amplified recently when I finally got my hands on the original Half Life for the first time and was left quite cold by its set up. Half Life 2 is a perfect example of a sequal surpassing it's original (In my opinion) graphically it recieved a big upgrade, the controls; refined, elegant almost perfect. Gone are the long LONG periods of time spent silently wandering down quiet, empty, repeating corridors and instead we have dialogue; Good dialogue and as if to go further good dialogue that doesnt outstay its welcome. 

if half life invented a story, Half Life 2 invented a Universe with Gordon this time exploring a wide and varying world, multiple locations and plenty of hidden goodies to keep even the most avid gamer busy for a good while. The Physics engine has seen a significant upgrade and for the time it was simply revolutionary (Although after the first 3-4 physics based puzzles it does get a bit overbearing) The enemys have also been refined somewhat, The large amount of Aliens and gunmen have been refined to around a dozen overall in game enemys and for me this works fine it helps create a stronger consistency and really feels quite natural. 

There are frustrating moments in the game, but nothing ever feels completely out of your reach and the boating and Car sections are a further welcome addition to the series, Although I personally felt the Boating sections did go on just a little bit to long. 

I shouldnt have to try and sell this game to you, my review is only going to be added to the high pile of positive reviews this game has already earned itself. It's simply a must play game and definately worth a place in your library, It's a different beast to anything Valve had released before and is quite simply; Magnificent.

Half-Life 2 is a First-Person shooter developed by Valve, and is considered one of the greatest games of all time... with good reason. Half-Life 2 has some of the coolest elements I have ever seen in a game.
Pros:
-Great Narrative is continued through a total FP perspective like Half-Life
-Well designed characters 
-Fun weapons, even cooler than Half-Life
-REALLY GOOD GRAPHICS (When I first played this game I thought it was a recently made game, but NOPE this game was made in 2004... 2004!!!)
-Variety of scenarios (You will be doing different things throughout the game and not just killing anything that moves)

Cons:
-At times some of the levels can be long and barren especially in the Highway 17 section
-Physics engine can be a pain sometimes especially in the Water Hazard  chapter where your air boat can be flipped over and you can't easily put it back up
-No Half-Life 3
Overall, (9.7/10) Half-Life 2 is a MUST HAVE for any steam user, despite minimal flaws this game is almost perfect. Now go get The Orange Box or GabeN will find you.

Neue Story, neue Waffen, neue Gegner, neue Umgebung(en) - so könnte man Half-Life 2 im Vergleich zum ersten Teil beschreiben.
Ich halte Half-Life 2 für einen würdigen und sehr guten Nachfolger von Half-Life, da es eindeutig mehr Interaktion mit den NPCs/ "mehr Story" gab (besonders zum Ende hin), die Grafik/ Physik besser ist, die Level abwechselungsreicher sind, der Anfang und das Ende ebenso fazinierend wie verwirrend sind wie beim ersten Teil und die Steuerung ebenfalls angenehmer ist.
Wenn man Half-Life gespielt hat, sollte man auf jeden Fall auch Half-Life 2 spielen - aber auch an sich, wenn einem das Genre gefällt.
